about: Hi! I'm Edmond. I'm currently pursuing a B.A. in Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley, studying at home in San Diego. I plan to graduate in May 2022.

My main passion is in creating useful, low-cost solutions to problems, which often combines both software and hardware. While I like to use hardware, I love to create software. I primarily use Python, although I've also had experience in Java, JavaScript, C, and C++. In web development, I've used tools such as React, Node.js, Bootstrap, Express, MongoDB, and REST APIs to make things work.

This semester, I'm helping to conduct research at UC Berkeley's RISE Lab. There, I explore the possibilities of end-to-end machine learning models on self-driving cars. I collect training data using a simulator as well as train models using PyTorch.

In my spare time, I like to tinker with and explore new technologies. In the past, I've built quadcopters from scratch and used open-source firmware. These days, I enjoy working with IoT and am always considering what I can do next.

In my free time, I enjoy hiking, playing tennis, and trying new foods. Occasionally, I might learn a new song on the piano, fold some intricate origami, or just draw and color something completely random.
headline: and I'm interested in all things tech, especially things that make people's lives easier. Check out my projects!

projects.title: Remote Garage Control
projects.description: Using Blynk's API and under 5 dollars of hardware, I'm able to open my garage from my phone! No need to purchase or carry remotes! An ultrasonic sensor checks if the garage is open. The hardware is programmed using C++ in Arduino. I use this site to store garage status and cycle history, which you can view in a small React app.

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.description: A responsive website that gave me plenty of practice using React and Bootstrap. Hosted on Heroku. Runs Express on Node.js. Other projects run on this site. Interestingly, I only had to pay money for this domain.

projects.title: Temperature Monitor
projects.description: Here, I log temperature data every fifteen minutes and save it using this website's API. Its code is integrated in throughout the website and garage controller, so no Github. But current temperature and data visualization is available on this site through a React app.

projects.title: URL Shortener
projects.description: This URL shortener does its job, and in my opinion, looks nice. It runs on this site with create-react-app as the front end, which calls an API to generate shortened URLs. I use a MongoDB Atlas database to store everything.

projects.title: Gitlet
projects.description: A project written in Java, supporting around 13 git commands. The program was written from scratch based on a very detailed project specification. Since this was in Java, I designed things using OOP principles. I also had to write quite a few unit and integration tests.

projects.title: School Pathfinder
projects.catchPhrase: Makes you climb hills and stairs.
projects.description: I used a shortest-paths algorithm (A*) to write a Python script that draws routes onto satellite images of the school.

projects.title: TankInfinity
projects.description: In a four-person group, I helped make a 2D survival shooter game written using LibGDX, an open-source game engine, and Java. Levels get progressively difficult until you lose. Download it under "Releases!"
